member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSessionError
member.summary: Handles errors that occur during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSessionError.ExeAsm
member.summary: A required log file component.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSessionError.HardError(Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSession,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Logs a hard error, updates the session log, and sends an error response to the client.
member.remarks:
This method performs the following actions:
Logs the error details using the session's trace log settings.
Appends the error message and relevant parameters to the session's running log.
Sends the error code and message back to the client as part of the response. Ensure that the parameter is properly initialized before calling this method.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.
The OptionObject error code.
The OptionObject error message.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Translation.FormId
member.summary: Provides functionality for retrieving form names based on form IDs and managing related metadata.
member.remarks: This class includes methods and properties for working with form identifiers and their associated names. It is designed for internal use and relies on a translation file to map form IDs to form names.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Translation.FormId.ExeAsm
member.summary: A required log file component.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Translation.FormId.GetFormName(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of a form based on its identifier from a translation file.
member.remarks: The method reads a translation file named "form_id-form_name.trans" located in the specified directory. Each line in the file is expected to have the format "formId=formName". If the specified matches the left-hand side of a line, the corresponding form name is returned. If no match is found, the default value "WSVC2491" is returned.
member.param: The unique identifier of the form to look up.
The directory path where the translation file is located.
The folder associated with the current session, used for logging purposes.
The maximum number of trace log entries to retain.
member.returns: The name of the form if found in the translation file; otherwise, the default value "WSVC2491".

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Translation.UserId
member.summary: Logic related to the USERID_User Description.txt file.
member.remarks: About this file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Translation.UserId.ExeAsm
member.summary: A required log file component.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Translation.UserId.GetUserDescription(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the full username of an Avatar Username/
member.remarks: e.g., JDOE becomes John Doe
member.param: The username of the avatar to look up
member.returns: The full name of the user associated with the specified avatar username.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Translation.UserId.CreateTranslationFile(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a translation file by reading and processing the contents of the specified original file.
member.remarks: This method reads all non-empty lines from the original file, trims any leading or trailing whitespace, and writes the processed content to a new file named "user_id-user_description.trans" in the specified directory.
member.param: The full path to the original file to be read and processed. Cannot be null or empty.
The directory path where the translation file will be created. Cannot be null or empty.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment
member.summary: Logic for Avatar environment components.
member.remarks:
An Avatar environment consists of two components: the Avatar System and Avatar System Code.
While both contain the word system, they are not the same! It is important to understand the difference between the two.
For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystem
member.summary: The Avatar System that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.

remarks.note:
Modify the AvtrSys setting
Open the Web.Config file located in the root directory of the Tingen Web Service.
Locate the AvtrSys setting within the applicationSettings section.
Change the value of the AvtrSys setting to the desired value.
Save the changes to the Web.Config file.
For example, to set the Avatar System to `LIVE`:
<setting name="AvtrSys" serializeAs="String"> <value>LIVE</value> </setting>
Changes to the AvtrSys setting will be applied the next time the Tingen Web Service is executed.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystemCode
member.summary: The Avatar System Code used to login to Avatar.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.ParseUnderscore(System.String,Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSession)
member.summary: Parses the specified form name and performs the corresponding action based on its value.
member.remarks: If the is "WSVC2491", a hard error is logged indicating that the form ID was not found in the translation table. For "OpenIncident", the method delegates to the OpenIncidentRequest.Parse method to handle the request. For other form names, a trace log entry is created without additional actions.
member.param: The name of the form to parse. This determines the action to be performed.
The object that contains all the information for this session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.ParseStatic(Outpost31.Core.TngnWsvcSession.WsvcSession)
member.summary: Parses static Script Parameter requests.
member.remarks:
A "static" request is one that does not change based on the form being used.
If the static request is not found, log a hard error.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.ErrorLog.Create(System.String,Outpost31.Core.Framework.Folders,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and writes an error log file for the specified user and error details.
member.remarks: This method generates an error log file using a predefined blueprint and writes it to both the current session folder and the log folder. The log file name is constructed using the error code and username.
member.param: The Avatar username.
The Tingen Web Service folder framework.
The executing assembly that caused the error.
The error code identifying the type of error.
The error message providing details about the error.
The path to the class that caused the error.
The method that caused the error.
The line of code that caused the error.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Logger.ErrorLog.LogContent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Formats a log message by replacing placeholders in the provided log blueprint with the specified values.
member.remarks: This method is intended for internal use to generate detailed log messages for debugging or error tracking. The parameter is processed to extract the class name, which replaces the ~CLASS~ placeholder.
member.param: A string containing placeholders to be replaced with log details.
The error code identifying the type of error.
The error message providing details about the error.
The executing assembly that caused the error.
The path to the class that caused the error.
The method that caused the error.
The line of code that caused the error.
member.returns: A formatted log message with all placeholders replaced by the corresponding values.

member.name: T:Outpost31.ProjectInfo
member.summary: Provides additional information about Outpost31.

remarks.para:
About the Tingen Web Service
Netsmart's Avatar is a behavioral health EHR that offers a recovery-focused suite of solutions that leverage real-time analytics and clinical decision support to drive value-based care.
While Avatar is a robust platform, it isn't perfect. The good news is that you can extend myAvatar functionality via Netsmart's Avatar Web Services, and/or custom web services that are written by other Avatar users.
The Tingen Web Service is one such custom web service which includes various tools and utilities for Avatar that aren't included in the official release, and provides a solid foundation for building additional functionality quickly and efficiently.
About Outpost31
Outpost31 is the back-end logic for the Tingen Web Service.

para.note:
Tingen project documentation:
Tingen Documentation Project
Tingen Web Service Manual
Development Documentation

Tingen project repositories:
Tingen Web Service
Outpost32
